Blog.post: I had another dream about being chased again last night. There was some sort of trial over a shooting, and even though the guy had the gun in his possession that he used to kill the victim, they couldn't use it, because it was his property. So a friend and I decided to steal the gun. urlLink "Weze stolez it" and I took off running with the evidence hoping it wouldn't go off. I ended up hiding out in a Domino's Pizza where the suspect and his friends also ended up. They didn't know, or let me to believe they didn't know I was the person they were looking for. We were watching the domino's pizza guy make those new domino's dots. (Note: Had kettle corn around 9:30 the night before.) The night before I had a dream where my aunt had another baby, 21 years after her youngest child. The baby was a boy, Joseph, with two odd middle names, Stawartz. This was a very detailed dream. They brought out pictures of their three oldest to find out who Joseph looked like, I think it was Larry, but he stuck out his tonge like Cory. Very, very strange dream. (Note: Had an Amaretto Sour around 10 the night before and dined on tootsie rolls before slipping into my peaceful slumber.)

Things I should have done when the urlLink crazy guy asked me out: 1. Said sure, I'm not busy. 2. Given him the phone number...what phone number you ask, one of urlLink these.

We just had our first real fire alarm after the new ones were installed. Funny thing was, as the man was say, "May I have your attention please, a fire emergency has been reported in the building..." we all sat wondering if it was real. Turns out it was, and two fire trucks showed up, one with a ladder, & two cop. The culprit: someone was left their toast in the toaster. This was way too much excitement for one day! I think we should all be sent home due to the fact that many individuals will not be able to function properly after this near death experience. (Okay, near death may be a little over dramatic, but I'll say anything if it'll mean I get to get out of work early.)
urlLink It's peanut butter jelly time!!

Maybe I'm wrong about always meeting strange guys on the street. Last week while driving some kid, well he looked young to me, was waving at me from his car, then putting his fingers up to his ears like a phone. Then again, how was I suppose to call him when I didn't have his number. Okay so he was strange too, but at least he looked like he took a shower that day!

So there I am innocently waiting at the bus stop, just waiting to go home, & I get hit on by a crazy man. (Why don't normal people scope me out?) This guys walking down the sidewalk saying hi to everyone. He says hi to me, so I return the hello. Actually I don't think I said hi, I think I just nodded. I don't want to be rude, any of you ever see the Dave Matthews Band video for Everyday? (Basically this guy decides he wants to be friendly to people & give strangers hugs. Some people are mean, and push him & beat him up. I wanted to be a nice person, & while I probably wouldn't hug a stranger, I will say hi, or nod.) This guy sees my acknowledgement stops & comes back to talk to me. Oh dear!! He asks me if I'm in school, where I work, where I'm headed, & where I live. Then asks if I'm want to go on a date. This may seem innocent enough, but he was giving me the hebe jebes! I declined, & he walked away. One of the guys that works in the same building I work in saw the whole thing go down. Actually he saw the guy coming & quicly turned around so he wouldn't acknowledge him again. Apparently the "crazy guy" did the same thing to him last week. I ask if he asked him out too, he said no...phew!! Apparently he got the creeps from this guy too, but was nice enough to keep an eye out for me in case he did something crazy, which was very nice of him. Next time I'll have to turn pretend like I'm busy next time he comes around. I don't know, maybe I'm making a mountain out of a mole hill...

Arvydas just signed on to St. Joe's University, and even though he threatened to kill me, I just want to say, Congratulations! Really I don't know why he'd want to harm me, I just sent him this innocent urlLink link .
I just found out last night that my little brother, gulp, is now driving! And in six months he'll be driving by himself! Congratulations Jon!
Went out with my good friend Cherie last night, and a guy complimented her on her...shoulders!!
I found out that my uncle & his dad's birthday's are April 28th, & 20th respectively. It's interesting to note, Hitler's birthday is April 20th & Hussein's birthday is April 28th. Hmmm...
No thank you Orbitz! I don't want a University Degree in days! Go away classmates.com! Okay, that's it, you can go back to what you were doing! Just wanted to vent a little.

One of the kids on my brothers urlLink basketball team , Linas Kleiza, played in the urlLink Jordan Capital Classic last night. I've met him once, actually, he scoped me out & introduce himself to me, what can I say I'm irresitable. He seemed like an okay kid, definitely plays a mean game of basketball! I went looking for a box score on last nights game, to see how he did & I found an urlLink article about his performance. I thought the article was good, praised Kleiza for being a "no-nonsense" player, opposite of LeBron James. I especially liked this quote, "There are no frills in his game," which I think is a compliment, but the quote goes on, "and no frills in his personality." Wow...that was harsh! (& apparently untrue!)

My friend urlLink Sara & I went to urlLink Quaker Steak & Lube last night for dinner, & honestly we couldn't have picked a better night...for it was Biker Night! This may be a little know fact, but I want a motorcycle. I'm not sure exactly what kind I want, only that a Crotch Rocket, & scooter (Cory!) are not options, but I definitly do want one. Driving to Cranberry was honestly a chore, cuz I was trailing four 4 guys on motorcycles. They seemed to be having the time of their lives, doing Pop-o-Wheelies, & my jealousy kicked in. Gotta get one, I kept telling myself. When I arrive at the Lube, there were well over 50 bikes, including the four I saw driving down, proudly on dislplay. I had to really concentrate on driving, wipe the drool off of my face, & reassure myself that soon, that too will be me! And Sara too!!
Just keeping track of my high score for urlLink Candy Cruncher ... Points : 14,258,500 Level : 44 Date : 10-May-03

It took me four months to finish my last book, Night Sins by Tami Hoag. Four Months!! The 10 books I read before that took me at most one week. Even folks at work were how long it was taking me to read and finish this book. Why? I've been asking myself the same question. Why? Was it a bad book? No I quite enjoyed it. Was time an issue? No, I do most of my reading on the bus to & from work. Weather, too nice to read inside? Nope, big chill here on the eastside. The problem I figured out is that my attention span is getting shorter & shorter. I learned in one of my college classes that the attention span of a child is their age plus one. We'll I'll tell you that even if that were true for older people, my attention span isn't 26 minutes. I blame this on Sesame Street! (Now if I can only find someone to blame for my periodic bouts of dyslexia???)
Nothing get the adrenaline flowing like waiting till the night taxes are due to start working on them!

Went to Fuel & Fuddle for lunch today, really good food btw, and even though it wasn't a chinese restaurant, they gave out fortune cookies. Here's what mine said...ahem... "A beautiful, smart & loving person will be coming into your life."

Congratulations to my cousins, Beth & Laurel on their performance at their school Talent Show. Also making an appearance, three of my stars from my rugrats basketball team, Maggie, Lauren & Rachel...good job to you all!!
The office smells like a "New Car" scented air freshener...I wonder why?
Sitting at a stop sign, waiting for the "light" to turn green...at a stop sign...oh man, I must be really, really tired.
There's nothing like putting on a brand new pair of pantyhose & having them rip before you get them all the way on!!

Dr. Cheng, who doesn't speak English, has given Lucky 6 months to live, which is a lot longer than the 1½ to 2 months the other Doctor gave. Dr. Cheng was also very eager to amputate Lucky's leg, right then & there. We declined. So, Lucky got some stronger meds, is expected to live for 6 more months, & is officially 6 years old. The longer life is definitely due to all the love & attention we've bestowed upon him in the last 2½ months. And of course, the cake I made for him, the roast I crock-potted for him, & the beer I tricked him into drinking! (Don't worry, he's old enough to drink 6 x 7=42.) edited to add: Pops is a very happy man!

Despite an exhausting Tuesday, I got up early this morning & went out to breakfast with Pops. Actually I was quite surprise at how easy it was to get him to go. We've (my cousin's & I) have asked him to go out to eat with us in the past, & he's politely turned us down. I guess the thought of pancakes, his favorite meal, was too tempting to pass up. Thanks for going to breakfast with me Pops!!
Uh, Ben, my buddy, my pal?!? Next time you meet urlLink Hines Ward , um, you can go ahead & give him my phone number! Thanks, you're swell!
It's a love hate relationship. I love it in fall when we gain an hour, I hate it in spring when we lose an hour.

I got this new pair of pants, finally got rid of the other kaki that were too short, and they are really confortable. However, they zip & button on the wrong side, & it's driving me crazy! It's like when you accidentally start putting your watch on upside down, you think, wait, somethings not right?!? I actually have to concentrate on fastening my pants...
He's not walking on his leg anymore, and not eating too much... We're taking him to the doctor on Wednesday.
Got out the ole laptop from GCC, and found out it still works!! After 2 years of hibernation I have my laptop again!!

Wow, not only did I lose my urlLink bet , but I lost my bet by 33, yes, 33 points... and this was a semi-final game? You'll get your donuts, soon enough!! My humble pie a la mode, was tasty, though...& Arvydas, I think you hustled me!
So Arvydas, how do you take your humble pie, warm, cold, or a la mode?

The Bet: • Outcome of Marquette/Kansas game The Participants: Arvydas L. • 6'9" male from Lithuania • HS Senior • Strengths: A damn good basketball player, knows the finer points of the game real well • Weaknesses: he's a male • Plays dirty by claiming he doesn't understand English, when he's losing an argument • Taking Kansas Miriam C. • 5'9" female from the US • Office asst. • Strengths: female intuition • Weaknesses: Can't play basketball to save life • Plays dirty by using words Arvydas doesn't know • Going with Marquette What's on the Table • If the Arvydas wins, Miriam agrees to fork over Krispy Kremes donuts, maybe a few Burger King bucks • If the Miriam wins, Arvydas agrees to let MC beat him in horse, a year of bragging rights (and post the picture of him in the urlLink Krispy Kreme Hat ...mwahahahaha) Who will be victorious?
Finally, my evil hair horns are gone...I am officially an angel again!

I was elated the other day to discover that my house had found favor in the eyes of a mama bird, looking for a place to raise her young. As I walk out the door each morning & look up, I see a little birdies nest, & hear the flap-flap of the mama bird flying away. Ah, nature. Now as I look down at the steps below the nest, I swear if I even get one drop of bird poop on any part of me, that nest is gone!
Yesterday I actually changed the cover of my phone to match what I was wearing. What's happening to me?

I had an absolutely fantastic Memorial Day weekend, with friends & family! Here's a brief run down: Friday: Fun didn't start till after work! Cherie & Sara came down & we went to the Carnegie Science Museum to see a laser light show to the tune of Tool! Very cool! Though next time, we'll have to sit further back so we can see more of the screen! Saturday: I went to the Zoo! with cousin Ben! All the animals were out, even a couple of the babies! Baby elephant, orangutang, & baby ape (or gorilla, I forget which one...) Sunday: Uncle Herb & Aunt Maria's annual Memorial Day Picnic/Mikey's Annual Birthday party. Always a fun time, good eatin', good company, good time! Monday: The best day of the entire weekend. Met up with a couple of friends & headed over to Post Gazette Pavilion for another annual event, X-Fest. The line up was, Godsmack, Staind, Evanesence, The Used, The Donnas, Punchline, Cold, The Juliana Theory, Taproot, Trapt, Seether, Smile Empty Soul, Breaking Benjamin, 12 Stones & Eve 6. Phew!! Granted, we didn't go see them all, but we got the major ones, Eve 6, The Juliana Theory (they played the one song I know, wasn't that nice of them?) Evanescence (rocked!), Staind (just as good as they were two years ago, if not better!) Godsmack (awesome!) Of course the best part of X-Fest was spending time with friends: Cherie: trying to blow powdered sugar on me! Sara: 30 Wiper, need I say more??? Chad: Bleeping out the Godsmack songs for his brother! BEEP!! Pat: rocking hard to the music! (Dance like no one is watching!!) Ahhhh...

My sister & new brother -in-law Dan Mellinger, left this morning to start their new lives in California! I wish them the best of luck, & lots of love & happiness! Will post a picture of the newlyweds when I can scan the pictures!!

Lucky, I'm convinced, knows English. He knows what's going on. A couple of weeks after we found out that he had cancer, & was given 1½ to 2 months to live, he became very sick, & we thought we were going to have to put him down for the night. Pops, wanting to be with his friend, slept downstairs, so Lucky wouldn't have to climb the stairs. I think Lucky knew something bad was going to happen in the near future, & summoned all the power from Helms Deep, & told himself to get better, which he did. Lately, due to the deterioating effects the medicine has had on his intestines, Lucky's had some diarrhea. And unfortunately, he's not been able to make it outside a couple of times. Plus, he's been getting really stubborn. Won't come downstairs in the morning to go out. Won't go out at night. Two nights ago, it's pouring down rain, & lucky won't go outside. I bribe him with General Tso's chicken & get him in the kitchen. He goes outside, I give him another piece & then heads right back for the door. So, thinking he just didn't want to get wet, I grabbed my umbrella (okay I didn't want to get wet either) heated up some more Tso's, put it on a plate and set in at the bottom of the steps. Boy was that dog being stubborn that night! He went down, took the chicken & then hauled ass back up the stairs (as quickly as a 150 lbs. rottweiller can with a bum leg) & back inside. So Pops stayed downstairs, just in case Lucky had to go in the middle of the night. He finally did at 4 AM. Pops has a short discussion with CJ about possibly putting Lucky down. He reasons that if he's having bathroom problems & won't be cooperative, what more can we do? Well let me tell y'all. This dog heard the word, put down, & he cleaned his act up! Last night, went outside with no problems, probably looking at Pops like, what's the fuss, it's not like I've never gone to the bathroom outside before!! Humans!! Went upstairs with no problems, came downstairs this morning, with everyone else, & went outside. I'm telling you, he knew!
urlLink Pictures of Montrose Grads signing. urlLink Article about Arvydas.

I am never going to a movie again without knowing how long it is. Last night I went to see the Matrix. Had no idea what how long it was. Going on the second hour I started to get a little claustrophobic, if you will. I swear I started hypervenilating, because I didn't know what time I was going to get out of there! Finally it ended. I remember the same thing happening when I went to see Braveheart. Completely forgot how long the movie was when I accepted the invitation to go. Once is okay, but twice is enough for me to say, never again!!
My sister's getting married, next Thursday.

Here's the story: A couple of weeks ago, my friends & I went to urlLink Sing Sing . While there, Nate, was beckoned to the other side of the piano stage by a group of eligible females. Cherie & I periodically stood up to look over to see if he was hitting it off! Well, the last time I stood up, Chad E. Savannah decided to pull my chair out from under me, as I sat down! I gracefully landed on the floor, on my butt in front of a whole lotta people! (Luckly, the entertainers didn't see, or I surely would have been roasted alive!) Well, I wasn't going to sit by the wayside & let Mr. Savannah get away with that, no siree! So I schemed, & I plotted, & today Mr. Savannah received his first subscription to the gay magazine, Unzipped. Paybacks a bitch ain't it! I say he got off easy! I had a lot more Mephistophelian ideas going through this imaginative brain. So Chad's declared war on me! I caution him though, I've got more where that came from! That was a mere warm-up! Be afraid, Mr. Savannah, be very, very afraid!
It's still here. Go figure!

It's taken 25 years for me to finally discover this, to find out the truth about myself...I'm a twin. Sure people have suspected it before: "Your & your brother look so much a like, you could be twins." (This statement always baffled me...) But back to my revelation, my brother, Mike & I are, in fact, twins. But not the kind you are probably thinking of, we are what are called Irish Twins. Irish twins are siblings born less than 12 months apart, my brother & I are 11½ months apart. So that makes us official Irish Twins...

Ever been listening to the radio, hear a song you like, but miss who sings it? Yeah, happens all the time. Well there's this urlLink website out there that has eliminated this problem. The idea is simple. You select a city, a radio station, & a time, and the song that was playing along with the artist comes up. Isn't that great? And it appears as though you can go back at least 100 songs, or more. This will be great for downloading new songs!

Last night mi amigos y yo attended the concert of a little known band, maybe you've heard of them, the urlLink Dave Matthews Band ? Unfortunately we missed the first five songs, but what we did see, was of course, amazing! Can't wait till 9/11 when we see them again! Friday, June 27, 2003 Post-Gazette Pavilion at Star Lake Set List: What Would You Say Granny Grey Street Rhyme & Reason Crash Captain One Sweet World Don’t Drink the Water Minarets If I Had It All Cry Freedom Ants Marching True Reflections Dreaming Tree Two Step Encore: Grace Is Gone What You Are

I find this so strange. The left front buckle on my Birkenstock keeps on coming out, but not enough for it to unbuckle, if that makes sense. I'll put the tab back in & sure enough I'll look down & it's out again. Don't know why it only does it on this side & not the other. I will have to see how many steps it takes till the tab comes out. Right after I find out how many licks it takes to get to the center of a tootsie pop.
Is there an unwritten rule, that if you are middle age & own a Cadillac you have to slick your hair back & look like a yuppy?
Arvydas is not fragile! Arvydas = Hahaha...

I went to the grocery store last night to get a few things. Every single line had about half a gazillion people in it, and since I didn't have a lot, I was looking for an express lane. I did not count, at this point, how many items I had, I just knew I didn't have a shopping car full, noticed a short line & hopped into it. A couple of seconds later, a lady gets behind me. That's all I really noticed, & just I went back to daydreaming about something. Like a minute later, one of the employees comes up and says, "Sorry, I have to do this" looks in my cart turns to the lady who was behind me and says, she has 9 items. I was like, who, what, what's going on? Then I saw the look of disgust on my former line neighbor, & she was asked to step out of the express lane cuz she had too many items, & then she complained that I had too many, too. Sheesh, how old are we?

So I got these urlLink Hulk Hands a couple of months ago, after seeing urlLink Shepard Smith , from urlLink Fox News , wear them on the air. They are really quite fun, especially at Charlie's expense. I decided to wear them to the airport yesterday when I was there picking up Jonathan. Do you think I got any looks? Sure did. The security lady pointed me out to the security dude & he started laughing! Actually got a lot of grins from folks, who quickly looked away when I spotted them. Others just chuckled to themselves. I think now, I can wear them running. I mean, if I can wear them at the airport, I surely can wear them around the neighborhood. Think of the protection they'll offer me? People will either stay away from me cuz they think I'm related to the Incredible Hulk, or they'll stay away from me cuz they think I'm crazy! Either way, they'll keep their distance.

Jon arrived at PIT last night right on time. He was greeted by me, his cousin Ben & his other cousin Mike. Due to the fact we haven't seen each other in a while, we decided we'd better make signs so he would know who we were. Ben held the JON sign, I held the SPEETS sign, whilst wearing my urlLink Hulk Hands . Mikey just held the I AM FAT sign. He walked right by us looking slightly embarrassed! Don't know why? And dang-it if he aint taller than me...argh!!
Sadly, I don't think urlLink Lucky will be here much longer.

I was taking the bus to work this morning & this lady gets on & sits right next to me. Which is fine, except there were tons of other seats available, including one to her left side. I thought there was an unwrittien law, like in urlLink bathroom etiquette that states if there are three spaces, the first to people should occupy the spaces farthest from each other. This lady didn't & at one point I thought I was going to start hyperventilation due to claustraphobia.

I really don't know why, but I've been remembering a lot of my dreams lately! Earlier this year, I had 3 or 4 dreams about my teeth, more specifically, one of my teeth chipping, cracking, basically falling apart. Had another dream like that last night. Now I have a tooth ache, coincidence? I think not!

"We are the middle children of history, with no purpose or place. Our generation has had no Great Depression, no Great War. Our war is spiritual. Our depression is our lives. We have been raised by television to believe that we'll be millionaires & movie gods & rock stars -- but we won't be. And we're very, VERY pissed off."

I have had several very strange urlLink dreams lately that I'd like to share with you all! Here they are in no particular order: This one was a couple of weeks ago. I dreamt that I was Clarice Sterling in Silence of the Lamb. I was running through the woods, like in the first scene, came upon my boss, then we happened upon a pick-up game of basketball where Dale Jones, a guy I work with, was playing while holding a cigarette. There were also amaretto sours involved. Also, one of my rugrats players was in the stands & I remember the bleachers having huge holes in them that kids could fall through & I remember catching one small child by the cranium trying to save it from falling. I know why I dreamt the second dream. I was in the middle ages, apparent because I was living in a castle, & everytime I went to use the little ladies room I would hit my head on the arch door way. The last time I hit my head I nearly passed out. And everytime I hit my head the same guard was there watching me. I dreamt this because Arvydas apparently hits his head every time he bounds up the stairs to talk to his neighbors. Oh & he hit his head on the light, that's always been there, that morning. Sucks being 6'9" I guess!" I also dreamt that Michael Jackson decided to sacrifice himself, for whatever reason, by being crucified like Jesus. Despite efforts by the courts to stop his self sacrifice, he was crucified. I know there was more, I'll be back! [no spellcheck, no proof reading]
The urlLink little birdies have all grown up & have flown away to face the world on their own! Oh, & I didn't get bird dropping on me!

Alzheimer's Disease (not something I want to learn) Art of Selling Art Below the Belt Boot Camp (hmm, people yelling at me & telling me what to do, um, no thanks) Chair Caning (why are we beating chairs?) Dancing at Wedding & Parties Ebay Auctions Emergency Room Friday Evening Supper Club Get Up & Move Invest in your Debt (Why?) Lubrication for Stationary Engineers (Are they stuck somewhere?) I got to play Mom last night as I took my cousins to a basketball game, Ben played in it, while the other three watched (pronounced tormented each other) & took notes.* They won, despite numerous, & I mean numerous bad passes, & lazy fouls (Ben fouled out.) And I didn't have to hear some punk kid say that's why we'z the champs of dis league...over & over & over & over again.** Anyway, back to my story. On the way home we were listening to one of my mix CD's. Mikey wanted to have a sing-a-long so we all sang to Mya's Ghetto Superstar , Sean Paul's Get Busy & Laurel did her, Back that Thang Up dance. After failed attempts to edit Eminem's Sing For The Moment (which is very hard if all you know is the Aerosmith part) I switched over to my urlLink Clarks Mix. To my surprise, Laurel, who's 8 (I think) inquires, "Wait, isn't this urlLink On Saturday ?" SCREECH!!! (those were my brakes, second & third exclamation points added for extra emphasis) "Why yes, yes it is!" She then informed me that she liked the song, her friend makes her "listen to it all the time. You see she has this Dave Matthews/Clarks mix..." (be still my heart) Meanwhile her older brothers & sisters sat there baffled. So Laurel & I had our own little sing-a-long to On Saturday : We're breaking up, you're moving out, on Saturday I'm losing friends, I'm losing face, I'm losing weight So get your things out of my place on Saturday On Saturday, on Saturday, on Saturday All the while Beth Anne sat there singing as well (keep in mind, this is the first time she's heard the song,) Ben sat there pulling out his hair yelling at Beth Anne to shut up cuz "you don't even know the words, you're saying them a second late," & Mikey no doubt thinking about the Wendy's food that was just out of arms reach in the front of the car. Kudos to Laurel for knowing who the Clarks are! ç root beer Time to burn the girl a new CD! I though about inviting her to the concert with us on Friday night, but I don't think I could find her a fake ID in time. Maybe next time. * Note to self: Rethink the whole having/wanting kids topic. ** Maybe I should change the title of this blog to cynical mirm

If you had a choice of one of the following desserts, which would you choose? Angel Food Cake Brownies Lemon Meringue Pie Vanilla Cake with Chocolate Icing Strawberry Short Cake Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Icing Ice Cream, or Carrot Cake Okay, now that you've made your choice, this is what research says about you: Angel Food Cake: Sweet, loving, cuddly. You love all warm & fuzzy items. A little nutty at times. sometimes you need an ice cream cone at the end of the day. Others perceive you as being child-like & immature at times. Brownies: You are adventurous, love new ideas, are a champion of underdogs & a slayer of dragons. When tempers flare up, you whip out your saber. You are always the oddball with a unique sense of humor & direction. You tend to be very loyal. Lemon Meringue Pie: Smooth, sexy, & articulate with your hands, you are an excellent after-dinner speaker & a good teacher. But don't try to walk & chew gum at the same time. A bit of a diva at times, but you have many friends. Vanilla Cake with Chocolate Icing: Fun-loving, sassy, humorous. Not very grounded in life, very indecisive & lack motivation. Everyone enjoys being around you, but you are a practical joker. Others should be cautious in making you mad, however, you are a friend for life. Strawberry Short Cake: Romantic, warm, loving. You care about other people & can be counted on in a pinch. You tend to melt. You can be overly-emotional & annoying at times. Chocolate Cake with Chocolate Icing: Sexy, always ready to give & receive. Very creative, adventurous, ambitious, & passionate. You have a cold exterior but are warm on the inside. Not afraid to take chances. Will not settle for anything average in life. Love to laugh. Ice Cream: You like sports, whether it be baseball, football, basketball, or soccer. If you could, you would like to participate, but you enjoy watching sports. You don't like to give up the remote control. You tend to be self-centered & high maintenance. Carrot Cake: You are a very fun loving person, who likes to laugh. You are fun to be with. ! People like to hang out with you. You are a very warm hearted person & a little quirky at times. You have many loyal friends.

Thank you all for coming to this press conference. I would like to start of by saying that on June 20, 2003, our beloved dog Lucky, was tearfully put to rest. Knowing this was going to happen, I, Miriam ask one Christopher James, to take my camera, which I had placed in his box, and take some final pictures of Lucky. Later on, when I inquired about the camera, he said that a Benjamin Alexander had it. Ben said CJ had it, CJ said Ben had it & that in fact he thought it was Ben's. This has gone on for more than a month as today is July 27th. I hereby announce that the camera in question has been in his possession. The camera was confiscated & placed back in the proper hands, mine. I offer my apology to Benjamin Alexander for accussing him of having it & for doubting that he gave it back to Christopher. Thank You! Are there any questions? No? Thank you all once again for attending my little press conference.

brought to you by Rinatta Paries of urlLink Thirdage.com 01. If you are a woman who generally pursues men first, stop & allow men to pursue you. Likewise, if you are a man who waits for women to ask you out, take the first step & ask them out instead. A woman pursuing a man sets up an uncomfortable power dynamic that is difficult to change later. 02. Early in the relationship, stay away from verbal foreplay. Engage in sexual-type talk only after you know each other well, at least a few months into the relationship. These types of conversations can become the central focus of your interactions, making it harder to experience other parts of your relationship. 03. Don't have a sexual relationship until you are committed to & love each other. This may seem old fashioned; however, relationships are partnerships. Although sexuality is a part of a relationship, it is not a good foundation on which to build one. If you build your relationship on sex, it will most likely fall like a house of cards. 04. In the beginning, limit your time together. See or be on the phone with each other in moderation. How is a house built? Brick by brick. How have you developed friendships? Over time. Does an intimate relationship deserve any less? 05. Spend more time courting in person rather than by e-mail or phone. Electronic communication has an aspect of anonymity & safety. It allows for a false sense of closeness. If this is your primary mode of communication, you may feel awkward with each other in person. 06. Be yourself at all times in the dating process. Doing so allows both of you to clearly see if the relationship will work. If you are compatible, you will discover more things to like about each other. If you are not compatible, you will be able to find out sooner rather than later. 07. Be clear from the start about how you want & don't want to be treated. It is better to know how your new partner responds to your boundaries & standards. 08. Be aware of who your new partner is. At the same time, don't automatically assume he or she will disappoint you in the same ways you have been disappointed before. Give your partner a chance to treat you well, rather than testing to see if he or she will cause you pain. 09. Accept your new partner as he or she is -- or don't engage in the relationship. If your partner's behavior bothers you but doesn't bother her, you can be sure that this behavior will continue. If you can't accept how your new partner is now, rather than hoping for change, it's a sign that you should get out. 10. Enjoy. Have fun. Connect. Learn. Dating is wonderful. It's a chance to meet new & interesting people & do fun activities. It's an opportunity for growth. If you do it gently, without jeopardizing your emotional well being, it will add sparkle to your life.

I left my house this morning & roaring down the street is this late model white blazer, with the front right side painted black. It stops at the 4-way stop & makes a left onto Laurel. But instead of continuing down the street he puts the car in reverse, in effect making a 5-point turn & heads down Laurel in the opposite direction. My question, why didn't he just make a right the first time? The answer: because I was heading down that way. Let me continue: So this blazer goes to the end of laurel & makes a right, I head left. Wouldn't you know it, the white blazer makes a U-turn on the road & heads back the way he came, the direction I am heading. There it is, undeniable proof that I am being followed! So if I happen to go MIA, look for a late model white blazer, with the front right side painted black. And no, my imagination is not running wild, & I resent the implication!

I got into a small discussion about double standards the other day. This is a topic I've thought about a lot. It's everywhere, at work, at school, really everywhere. I guess what stemmed this recent conversation was school. The college I went to appeared to write the book on double standards. Some of the ones I can remember are: Females had to sign into the dorms after a certain time. This was for protection, or so they say. But we all thought it was to keep an eye on what time people were coming in at night. Honestly, all they had to do was check ID's to make sure that the person entering the building was indeed a student, & since no males were allowed in the buildings, a rapist or someone like that would have had a hard time walking down the hall & not being notice. Though never confirmed, we all imagined what would happen if parents call in asking about their daughters grades & the Dean of Women pulling out the sign in sheets saying, well your daughter seemed to stay out late, she usually signed in after 12 x times a month. (The funny thing is, & this happened to my friend, she signed in a lot of times, but that was because she was in the library till it closed, which happened to be the same time signing in started.) Guys were not required to sign in at all. This leads to my second gripe. Freshman had a curfew first semester. All freshman were required to be back in the dorms by a certain time, which happen to be the time females were required to sign in. If as a freshman you violated curfew a certain number of times, you got to visit with the Dean. Problem was, guys could enter in any door & women (all doors leading outside were locked except for the main entrance) had to enter in the main door & sign in. So any guys violating curfew would never get caught, but females well, there was really no way around it. Totally unfair in my book. Intervis is a specific time set aside where members of the opposite sex can visit friends in their dorms. This wasn't the biggest double standard that my college had. Basically for men, if you could find a sign in sheet, hooray, but if you couldn't, no big deal. For men visiting female dorms there was a set procedure. The female must sign in the male guest & escort him to her room. If for they wanted to change rooms, she had to escort him back down to the mail lobby sign him out & a person from the new room had to sign him into her room & escort him up to her room. What a pain it was. And because of this policy, there were no hall "parties" in the female dorms, because no males could linger in the halls. We are here to protect our females. The men can protect themselves." That's what we were told, of course we were also told that if a girl gets raped in a girls dorm, the school would be liable. But if she were to get raped in a guys dorm, well, she was "asking" for it, why else was she up there. I'll stop right there before this ends up being longer than it is. I'll only say, I'm sick of people saying that "she deserved it!" Women were not allowed to have housing groups (Greek group without the "rush" aspect) & they wouldn't section off halls for the sororities. Whereas men were allowed housing groups & the administration set aside halls for the housing groups & fraternities. No real explanation was given as to why this was, & females are left praying they won't get stuck on a sorority hall. I don't know, maybe I'm making a mountain out of a mole hill, but these (and I'm sure there are more, like the whole fire alarm thing, I just remembered) really got to me. And the college stated they wouldn't discriminate based on sex. I find this a perfect example of a double standards.

urlLink Cedar Point was just way too much fun, again. The weather was perfect, the crowds were minimal & well it was just a good time! The urlLink Dragster is the newest ride, going 120 mph & is 420 feet high. I left thinking that I wouldn't be riding it because I had heard it was broken. When we pulled up to the park, it was running & I was excited! We headed there first & once we got to the entrance they shut it down & it was down for most of the day. Then to our amazement we saw it running again, & we ran as quickly as possible to the ride, hoping it wouldn't shut down while we were standing in line. I didn't, we rode it, & it was awesome. I don't know how fast our ride was, while standing in line we saw it go between 120-123 mph. The coolest part about it was a sign that said not to be alarmed if the car did not make it over the top. And everytime we hoped it wouldn't make it, but it always did. The next day, I swear they ran it less than 20 times. I hope they find out what's wrong with it. Though of course, the people waiting in line, hoping to get on, kept the other lines realatively short. Maybe it's all part of the Cedar Point Plan...mwhahaha! Actually they had problems with several rides, none I was on thankfully. The urlLink Mantis broke down, the urlLink Wicked Twister , the urlLink Dragster & the urlLink Millenium Force all broke down at one point, & all are probably some of the more popular rides. Oh well... Some of the funny moments: Someone forgetting to get on the ride... "I don't understand, what's a to WN is..." The shirt read, A drinking town, with a football problem! Oh & the urlLink muffleheads made there appearance last night. What a sight. Rounding the corner & seeing the pavement covered in with these mayfly looking bugs. Sends shivers down my spine just thinking about them.

The bus ride to work was mighty quiet today. Maybe it's always like that in the morning, I usually have my headphones on, forgot them today, but it did seem unusually quiet. No one using their outdoor voices while talking about personal information on their cell phone & no one even talking with the person beside them. This wasn't so on the ride home yesterday. I was sitting in the back of the bus yesterday, & this lady gets on, kinda with a pissed off look on her face, sporting an 80's looking ripped sweatshirt. We're driving by the Rita's Italian Ice (??) shop in Squirrel Hill when she stands up & peers out the window. I noticed this because she was practically standing in front of & peering over the guy next to her, & I was thinking, that she was invading that guys personal space, & that I would be going crazy. So she's glaring out the window, then frantically tries to open it. She finally gets the sliver of a window open & she yells out, "When's the last time you fed your dogs!" over & over. The bus starts to move & she notices all these back bus people staring at her, so she starts to explain. "I work in animal rescue, & that sort of thing just sets me off. I mean you could see their ribs, & they're sitting there enjoying ice scream! It's just not right!" I didn't hear all the conversation, cuz I was drifting in & out of consciousness (I was tired) & was listening to either, Devil Went Down to Georgia or Pour Some Sugar on Me. She ranted on till we got to Wilkinsburg. Man, she was passionate about it, she works in animal rescue...

Eat A Bug Day! This according to the urlLink Creamed Peas calendar. My brother Mike would appreciate this day. You may have never intentially eaten an insect (my brother aside) but you have probably inadvertently consumed over a pound of insects in your lifetime. Your insect consumption adds up. Flour beetles, weevils, and other insect pests that infest granaries are milled along with the grain, finally ending up as tiny black specks in your piece of bread. Small grubs & other tiny insects can be found in your fruit & vegetables. Insects are especially common in canned & other types of processed food, & even in certain beverages. It is virtually impossible that you have not ingested insects in one form or another during your lifetime. And it probably did not harm you, but instead did you some good by providing extra protein in your meal!

In an apparent quest to learn more about Lithuania, I came across this urlLink web page where you could actually "learn" the language in just 6 easy lessons. I skipped lesson #1 & immediately went to urlLink #2 because it contained Simple Everyday Phrases . The first set are good to know: Do you speak English, German...? I speak English, German... Do you understand me? I don't speak Lithuanian. May I smoke? etc. But then they started to get a little weird. Apparently these are common phrases in Lithuania: You are my little pussy cat/sex kitten/King Kong. I am your Romeo/Juliet and you are my Juliet/Romeo! I will die without you!...Eventually. Do you want to have my babies? Darling! Take me now! Give me back the sweater my granny knitted. My mother warned me about you. Your hands are like cabbages. I'm going to Tibet to find myself. She means nothing to me. Your neediness is unattractive. I am a rock. I am an island. What's love got to do with it? My cat and I get along fine. Who's got time for love? Look! There's a mermaid! Don't worry. There's lots more fish in the sea. You are the hottest spot on the beach. Oh my God. Sausage again! I'm sick of it. Will you join me as I scratch my head...

While I'm not a huge fan of astrology, it interesting to see how accurate they are. Here is my "personality" based on my birthday, month, day & year. I agree with very little of it, most of it is just like, huh, I'm like that? Maybe it's just my perception, & maybe everyone else sees me like this. Your sign is that of witty Gemini, the third sign of the zodiac, the sign that is characterized by communication. Geminis are very intellectual individuals, & are forever interested in broadening their horizon - they are eternal students! Mercury, the planet of communication, rules your sign, & makes you an articulate & versatile person. You are outgoing & sociable, & due to your lively attitude, you are the born entertainer. Clever & ingenious, you usually get what you want with your charm & wit. First of the three air signs, you are a dexterous, multifaceted, & flexible individual. As the most diverse & eloquent sign of the zodiac, you crave mental stimulation above all. Your curiosity, combined with your ability to synthesize information, makes you the messenger of knowledge & information. As a Gemini, you rule the third house, the sector of your chart that describes how you perceive, process, & communicate facts. It also has to do with short journeys, siblings, neighbors, & anything within arm's reach. Your sign is a mutable sign, responsible for keeping information flowing. You are gifted in adapting to situations & making compromises. Of all the zodiac signs, you are the peacemaker & troubleshooter who actively finds solutions to tricky situations. Your strengths, dear Gemini, lie in your cleverness, inquisitiveness, & openness to exploring new ideas. Once you have found something that interests you, you proceed with logic & scientific precision. However, as soon as you've consumed a subject, you are also able to switch your focus to a new topic. With your naturally practical & skilled approach, you excel in whatever you put your mind to. One of your main weaknesses is that you can be shallow & hypocritical in your dealings with others. You can confuse people with your unpredictability & cynical attitude, & they might not trust you completely. Since your brain works so quickly, you tend to be nervous, restless, & anxious, which sometimes leaves you highly irritated. urlLink Wanna try?

My little brother just got back from urlLink camp & he informs me that he & another cabin member have thought up the idea of a Lazy Camp. I was driving down the freeway with the window down, listening to urlLink Seether , when I hear something hit my car then hit me. I look down & there's this huge fuzzy bee sitting on my shirt. I freak & try to flick it away. I successfully did, but where does it go? Down my short leg. EEK! So I lean on my right side, so I don't inadvertently get stung, till I can safely pull over & get rid of the bee down my shorts! I pulled over got out, did a little diddy to shake the bee out & nothing falls out. So I look back in the car to see if maybe, just maybe, it didn't fall down my short & actually ended up on the floor. I couldn't find it. Not satisfied that it's gone, I get back into my car & take off my shorts. I shook my shorts & out comes the damn bee. Why didn't it fall out when I did my little diddy on the side of the road! Argh! You know, I just thought of something. I put the bee in the trash in my car (why I didn't just throw it out the window is beside me) & I really don't know if it was dead or not. What if it gets out & hids somewhere in my car from me? Double EEK! I'm going on a bee hunt!

Yesterday while I was falling asleep on the bus, it broke down. I was listening to my music a little loud, so I didn't hear what the problem was, but when we sat in the same spot for a while I knew something was wrong. (I know, I'm a genius – in disguise.) I was determined to wait till the new bus arrived, but realized that I was on a very busy route & could catch another bus. (See genius comment.) So we are waiting & woohoo, another 61A! – drives right by us, the driver sporting a "sorry I'm full look." So again, me & bus broken down bus compadres, wait & woohoo another 61A – drives right by us, this driver also sporting a "sorry I'm full look." So now I'm getting a little peeved. My foot starts twitching rapidly. And again I wait & woohoo another bus. Damn! 61C, doesn't go by my house. So, we find me waiting again. I was beginning to wish I had a stereo with me, that way all the broken down bus people & I could have a little dance party on the side of the road, but alas I didn't have one. Finally a packed 61B comes struggling up the hill. This very generous driver, despite being pack, lets us all on; so what if some people are in front of the yellow line! *gasp* I finally get home, ½ later than normal. This is about the 3rd year I've used public transportation & the first 2½ I was never on a bus that broke down. In the last ½ a year, I've been on at least 2, no make that 3, buses that have needed mechanical attention.

The history of contraception... One of the first-ever written prescriptions for a contraceptive device is a papyrus sheet from Egypt dating back to 1550BC, which describes a tampon made of seed wool moistened with ground acacia, dates and honey. Despite its primitiveness, the tampon worked in part because acacia ferments into lactic acid, an ingredient in today's spermicides. Three thousand years ago in India and Egypt, dung from animals thought to possess mystical powers - such as crocodiles and elephants - were inserted into the woman's vagina prior to intercourse to prevent pregnancies. Women strapped amulets containing mule's earwax, weasel's testicles and a bone taken from the right side of a totally black cat to body parts to avoid pregnancy. "If one takes the two testicles of a weasel and wraps them up, binding them to the thigh of a woman who wears also a weasel bone on her person, she will no longer conceive." More dangerous contraceptives included the drinking of lead and mercury by Chinese women thousands of years ago, which often led to sterility or death. The use of a six-sided wooden block - known as a pessary - as a barrier in the vagina was later condemned as an "instrument of torture" in the 1930s.

I remember thinking as I saw airplanes in the sky how "weird" it would be to see it suddenly crash. After 9/11 it doesn't seem that weird. This leads me to the dream I had last night. I was living in our old blue two story house on Rising Hill Drive, chilling in the back yard when I saw a low flying plane. Okay, keep in mind this is a dream, one of mine no less, but on one of the wings there was this lady filming something with her video camera. The plane flew around, came back & crashed into the house next to ours. Apparently the plane ran out of fuel, which is why there was no explosion & the only house that had any damage was the house that got hit.

I attended the Counting Crows/John Mayer Concert on Thursday evening & absolutely had a blast! Despite being an hour late meeting my compadres (damn Pittsburgh traffic) we got in some quality pre-concert tailgating! We dined on Kilbasi, EL Fudge cookies & Smirnoff Ice Black! While there I ran into (not literally) a couple people from my past. Coach Marhefka & his wife were there, & I have to say, there's nothing more challenging than trying to carry on a conversation with someone, while trying to appear completely sober. Then while in the ladies room I saw Jamie Hoffman. The funny thing is, the last time I saw her was at the Barenaked Ladies concert two years earlier, at the same venue! The highlight of the evening, besides the concert, had to have been the guys sitting behind us. We were sitting in our seat when we hear, "Where are you guys from?" We turned around & there were three guys sitting there, who we found out were from Canada. They drove 12 hours to come to see John Mayer, & boy were they excited. Counting Crows played (in no particular order): Mr. Jones, Big Yellow Taxi, Hangin' Around, American Girls, A Long December, Hard Candy, Mrs. Potter's Lullaby, Miami, Omaha, 'Round Here, & Rain King John Mayer played (again, in no particular order, & might even be missing some): 3x5, No Such Thing, Why Georgia, Your Body Is a Wonderland, Someday I'll Fly, Something's Missing, Come Back to Bed, & '83.

I'm tired, but I think I've been getting enough sleep at night. Not too much to warrant being tired from too much sleep, but enough to where I should feel rested. So I've come up with an explanation to why I'm so tired: I'm not falling asleep, rather I slipping into a comatose state. As we all know, people in coma's aren't asleep, just unconscious. So I believe I slip into one of these comatose states one second before I fall asleep, preventing me from actually sleeping, then when the alarm clock beeps, I'm "awaken" from my comatose state, no more rested than I was the night before.

Latest buzz: Moth in woman's ear for 4 days A Scottish woman who heard buzzing sounds in her head is said to be horrified after discovering a moth had taken up residence inside her ear for four days. The Midlothian woman rushed to the doctor, who initially thought the problem was caused by an excess of wax. But when a nurse syringed Patricia's ear four days later, the body of a moth oozed out. At the height of the mystery, Graham says both he & Patricia were at their wit's end trying to figure out the problem. "The noise was driving her crazy," he told the paper. "It was quite frightening, I looked in her ear & could see nothing. It went on for more than four hours then the thing must have died." Patricia has since recovered from last month's ordeal, & is now able to joke about it, according to the report. "People always talk about how earwigs got their names, but I've never heard of anyone getting a moth in their ear," Paul Kirkland, head of conservation with Butterfly Conservation Scotland, told the News. A hospital spokesman says cases of insects like spiders or flies in ears are rare, but they have occurred, & usually can be removed by cleansing the ear at a doctor's office.

So what makes a metrosexual man? He's been defined as a straight, sensitive, well-educated, urban dweller who is in touch with his feminine side. He may have a standing appointment for a weekly manicure, & he probably has his hair cared for by a stylist rather than a barber. He loves to shop, he may wear jewelry, & his bathroom counter is most likely filled with male-targeted grooming products, including moisturizers (& perhaps even a little makeup). He may work on his physique at a fitness club (not a gym) & his appearance probably gets him lots of attention -- & he's delighted by every stare. Just wanted to make you all aware...carry on!

My Alarm Clock... I come up with these scenarios when I'm sleeping, that usually incorporate my alarm clock somehow. Thursday morning, while my alarm clock was going off, I conjured up in my mind one of those scenario. I looked at the clock @ around 5:30 and thought, I better turn off this alarm clock so my 6:30 alarm clock can go off. So I press the 24-hour snooze button & wait/expect/anticipate the 6:30 alarm clock to go off. At 7:00, the time I'm usually like, eek, I better get out the door, I wake up. I have no second alarm clock, of course, I couldn't have realized that when I was pressing my 24-hour snooze button. So this morning, I paid extra attention to which snooze button I press & I did real well, untill about 6:18, when I pressed the wrong one & I realized it a moment too late. This is one of those times when the urlLink CRTL+Z function in life would come in handy. Don't worry though, I woke up on time! My Dinner Last Night... I made this sauce to go on top of some rice, an alteration to another recipe. I made too much, went by the recipe I had, & realized too late, that I am the only one who'll be eating this. And I don't care too much for leftovers. (This is when having a dog is nice...) So I made the sauce, really it wasn't that hard, & then proceeded to make the rice. Christophè was impressed with my rice preparation, but once again, by the time all the water evaporated, or was absorbed by the rice, it was still crunchy. I've got to learn to perfect the art of rice making. Or I could just stick to urlLink pasta , it's so much easier. When Men Get Sick... When men get sick, they become babies. I was told a couple of weeks ago that I needed to get in shape. Let me say how much I admire & love brutal honesty. So after thinking about exercising & not seeing any results, I figured I better start physically doing it. So on Sunday I did some push-up, sit-up, worked on the urlLink triceps & then I ran (some errands). When I could think of no more excuses to prevent me from jogging, I finally bit the bullet & went. Many times this summer I've "started" running, but, because of the large amount of rain we gotten, I've had to stop after one or two days. (Sugar melts, so me running in the rain is not a good idea. And I'm too poor to buy a membership to a club, so running outside is my only option.) Can you see where this is going? Sunday I ran, Monday it rained. Argh! The rain wins again. Today however, is looking quite nice, so maybe I'll try the jogging thing again. If the weather changes & it ends up raining again, maybe I'll finally take the hint & realize that getting in shape was just not meant to happen. Back to the whole jogging outside: I'd like nothing more than a ferocious looking dog by my side while I'm jogging, especially now that it's getting dark sooner. I remember one time taking Lucky for a walk around the neighborhood & a guy practically started yelling at me to keep Lucky away from his kids. I was baffled, Lucky was the sweetest dog, wouldn't hurt a fly, then it hit me, he's a 145 lb. Rottweiller, so while I know he's a big teddy bear, to others, he's was a big ferocious Rottweiller. Lucky would have been a good candidate for my Protect Mirm while Running Campaign , except, well he's no longer with us, he had this bathroom problem & he's was more out of shape than me. Wait, there's Charlie our 100 lb. Boxer. He's ugly enough to scare away potential attackers, but there's one big problem. Anyone who has ever met Chuck will notice when he's barking at you, he's positioned his back end toward you, so he can bolt at the first sign of trouble. Also, I walk him around the block & he's still gasping for air 3 hours later. So, I'm picturing, me out running with Charlie (actually probably by this time I pulling him) an attackers jumps out of the bush, Charlie proceeds to bark in his "I'm gonna bolt" stance, the attacker approaches him, he starts to run, but then is stricken by a heart attack (or faints) rendering him useless. So, unfortunately, Charlie is also not a good candidate, even though, he would be more than willing. So I'm left with the urlLink Hulk Hands idea, getting a new ferocious dog (I'm afraid the Mini Pinscher or Beagle I want won't keep me safe), taking my chances that I won't get attacked, or not go running outside at all. Such a hard decision...

I especially miss him shaking my hand every morning before I went to work, Him lying on his back, paws up in the air, teeth exposed, waiting for his tummy to be scratched, & the efforts he made to greet me at the door when I came home from work, even when he couldn't walk.

Or are there & I just don't realize it.

flacÂ·cid adj. 1. Lacking firmness, resilience, or muscle tone. 2. Lacking vigor or energy Flaccid was one of the vocabulary words in my 12th grade English class with Connie Cutler. Ms. Cutler was one of those teacher that you either loved or hated. I didn'tparticularlyy care too much for her. On the last day of classes, right before graduation, she made everyone shake her had & look her in the eye, while she said something nice about them. She shook my hand & look me in the eye & said, "Your brother was great!" From that point on, I really didn't care for her. But I digress... While we were reviewing each of the vocab words, she told us a story about how one of her students remembered the word flaccid. He said that the double c's in the middle reminded him of Connie Cutler which in turn reminded him of the tricep region in her arms, which, as he described, were quite flaccid. Today I realized it's time for me to start doing some push-ups & tricepexercisess, as my arms have become quite flaccid, & I refuse to have arms like Connie Cutler. (Looking at me you'd never believe that I was a shot-putter in college, or that I had, at one point, a lifting urlLink coach .)

Every so often in urlLink The Pitt News they publish anything that the Pitt Police have responded too. Mostly it reports students who have been caught drinking underage, disorderly conduct, theft, or trespassing. But sometimes you'll read some strange ones: Thursday, Sept. 11 •4:04 p.m. — Officers picked up a sick squirrel in a box near the William Pitt Union & transferred it to Animal Control. Wasn't that nice of them? My favorite of all time happened a couple of months ago. Friday, May 16 •7:39 a.m. — Someone's finger was injured in Posar Hall. Okay now picture someone calling campus police saying: "I hurt my finger, come help!" Are you laughing too?
Cherie & I obey all posted traffic signs. We paid particular attention to the "Keep Alert" signs & the "No U-Turn" signs.

My chariot arrived 15 minutes early, I didn't care, I was ready to leave. urlLink Cherie & I picked up our rental (a white Malibu with North Carolina plate) packed up & headed east to Hershey. Evil forces (known as the people who are responsible for putting up road signs, but haven't done so) tried to prevent us from locating our hotel with ease, but we persevered & after touring Harrisburg we were finally able to locate our "castle." After freshening up, we headed out to the Hershey Park Arena to see, for the second time this summer, the urlLink Dave Matthews Band . My two favorite parts of the show were when he played Granny & the mad scatting at the end of Jimi Thing. (I’m pretty sure it was Jimi Thing.) My favorite part that had nothing to do with the show was the guy interpreting all the songs & having a good time. The next day we, or should I say, I got us lost in Philadelphia & three hours after our ETA, we got to St. Joseph’s University. Our person of interest was no where to be found, so we headed to our hotel in Horsham, & then went to dinner at the residence of some old college friends. Saturday, we were suppose to head to New York City, but we discovered that it was forecasted to rain the entire day, so urlLink Cherie & I were left with a dilemma. Do we brave out the rain & continue with our plans, plan something else or merely alter them. We decided instead of traipsing around Manhattan, we would just take in a play. We armed ourselves with ponchos & headed out. It rained pretty much the entire 1½ hour drive. Once we got to Liberty Park it stopped raining. We took a ferry to Ellis Island, departed the ferry at Liberty Island & visited with Lady Liberty. We re-boarded the ferry, back to Ellis Island, then finally on to Battery Park. We walked around Battery Park & literally happened upon the World Trade Center Site. It was definitely eerie. Even though we had visited the Flight 93 memorial, the actual crash site was off in the distance, here at the WTC site, it was right there in front of us. We continued on toward the East River & had dinner near Pier 16. We then walked through Chinatown, trying our hardest to blend it, but I assure you, in Chinatown it didn’t. Our destination was Little Italy, but where it was suppose to be according to the map, in real life, it wasn’t there. So we started to head back when we happened upon the urlLink Feast of San Gennaro . This event is described as New York City's oldest, biggest & best street festival & went on for blocks. We went to visit Wall Street, saw the NYSE & caught a Water Taxi to take us back to Liberty Park. The eight hours we were there it only rained on us once, at the Feast of San Gennaro. Even though we didn’t see lots of “recommended sites” (Manhattan’s a lot bigger than I realized) I’m glad we decided to go, & maybe next time, we’ll spend more time there & experience more. On Sunday, we stopped by St. Joe’s to say hi to Arvydas, & then headed home. Along the way we visited urlLink Beth in Carlisle, picked up urlLink Sara & caravaned home. It was on the way home urlLink Cherie & I discovered just how much fun one could have with grapes in a rental car. That was my weekend in a nutshell…

I'm starting to think in computer shortcuts. Let me explain. I'll do something, not on the computer, & wish I'd done it differently. (For example, today, I stapled some papers together & then realized there were more papers that needed to be added to the stack.) The first thing reaction, or thought, most people would have is, "I need to unstaple the paper." My first reaction is "That's okay, I'll just CTRL+Z!" (that's the keyboard shortcut for undo last action.) Then I realize I can't just CTRL+Z, I actually have to do it. Wouldn't it be great, though, to have a CTRL+Z function in real life.

Vanessa was adopted & brought to the United States from Honduras. I had know of her for a couple of years, through mutual friends, but it wasn't until the sixth grade that we were able to become friends, we had gone to different school up until then. Vanessa's parents owned a horse ranch with quite a number of horses. At one time there were rumors to be around 80. Her chores daily chores consisted of riding the horses. She wasn't an only child, she had a brother & sister, but she was the only child living at home. At times I think the only reason she was adopted was to help around the ranch. Because of her schedule, she wasn't allowed to socialize much. We talked on the phone often, but when it came to birthday parties, she'd be invited, but we all knew she wouldn't come. I think in the many years she lived in Temecula she may have gone to one party. She was always the fasted girl in PE, which contributed to her getting a college scholarship in cross country. She hated her middle name, but we all loved it, Alexis, sounded like royalty. One of our field trips was to Tijuana Mexico & she thought for sure that she wouldn't be allowed to cross back over the border, so at times she would hide behind someone, if a Mexican Policeman walked by. Her family moved to Weatherford Texas before high school. We corresponded on occasion, but that slowed down. The summer before my freshman year at college I was on some boring church youth group activity & got to talking with one of the other girls. Somehow we got on the subject of Vanessa & she nonchalantly said, you know she was killed in a car accident. Surely you jest? I thought that because, it appeared as though this girl had a smile on her face. I learned later that she wasn't. Vanessa had been driving when a dog ran into the road. She swerved to avoid hitting it & crashed into a tree. That's all I know. Today would be Vanessa's 26th birthday & I just want to wish her a Happy Birthday & let her know that I haven't forgotten about her...

But revenge & hatred won't be why we'll go on. We'll go on because we know this is a good country, a country worth keeping. Those who would destroy it only make us see more clearly how precious it is. ~Dave Barry

Yesterday I went over to the CVS & there was a guy standing out front asking for money. The last couple of times I've given people money, I've been taken for a ride, so this time, I politely declined. This morning I headed toward the CVS & the same guy comes walking out of the parking lot that's between my building & the drug store. He says something to me, proceeds to follow me, too close I might add, to the CVS, & stand outside the door as if was going to wait there till I came out. They didn't have what I wanted, so started to leave, when I noticed the guy was still at the front door. I decided to browse a little longer, all the while hoping someone from work was there & I could walk out with him. I spotted someone, but I didn't know him to well & he was taking forever, so I went to looked outside again. I didn't see the guy, so I booked it out of there & made it safely to my building. What worries me is that I've seen this guy twice in two days & he recognizes me. My imagination always runs wild without any fuel feeding it; it doesn't need anything like this. I only hope I'm making something out of nothing.

I asked Jon if he was coughing up black soot yet. He said "breathing sucks, but not having trouble, basically can't see the sky." The news is reporting that these are the worse fires in 10 years. Ten years ago I would have been a sophomore & taking Algebra II with Mr. Rapaport. Rap lived in Murrieta, which is at a higher elevation than Temecula, & he was the one that made the comment that it looked like Temecula was surrounded by fire. I wonder what it looks like now. I honestly can't believe it was that long ago, kinda seems like yesterday. Jon would have been in 1st grade. I'm starting to feel old.
I finally found a urlLink visual with all the SoCal fires marked. Well you can see the Temecula/Hemet fire. Thankfully it's not as big as the others. Oh & my high school is being used at a shelter.

Okay, so we just ended daylight savings. So all our clocks were set back one hour. Last week at this time it would have been 3:06 PM. So why does my computer clock say 1:06 PM? I guess someone got setback happy & decided to try for 2 hours instead of one. But you know what, if I end up leaving work late because of it, I'm not going to be happy. I'd change it but: You do not have the proper privilege level to change the System Time.

Ha-ha, I crack myself up! He did say though that he could smell the fires that are ragging all over SoCal. I didn't really get an answer out of him when I asked if they were close, but I am assuming they aren't, if he was still going to school. I honestly remember there always being a fire on Mt. Palomar at the beginning of every school year. Maybe it was just two or three, but that was enough to make it seem like a yearly tradition. One year, there were numerous fires encircling my little town of Temecula & according to my math teacher, it looked like all of Temecula was going to be engulfed. I had this dream many years ago that a wall of fire that originated near the coast & was moving east, & was going to eventually burn all of California. (Nevermind California falling off into the ocean, fire was going to be it's demise.) So we got trash bags & started throwing clothes, pictures & whatever else we could save in the back of my dad's pickup & hopped into the car to try to get out of the fires path of destruction. I pray the fires are put out quickly, that no more homes & lives are lost & the people who started them are caught.

I'm getting a little annoyed at people who complain that I never call, e-mail, visit, or basically keep in touch, with them. If I don't keep in touch with you, it's for a reason. If I call you & am always getting booted so you can talk to someone else, I'll stop calling. I figure, if/when you want to talk to me, you will. And, if you never pick up the phone to call me & only talk when I call, most likely I'll stop calling. If I can put forth the effort, you can too. If I continually e-mail with no response, I'll assume either you don't want to correspond with me, or you are too busy & I'll take the hint & leave you alone. I don't want to be classified as being annoying or clingy. I'll be happy to visit you anytime. But you have to make an effort sometime, to visit me. And by all means I'm not saying that it has to be a one for one sort of thing, just some effort on your part is nice. Those of you who know me, know that I am not one to volunteer information about myself & know that I hate talking about myself. It's just how I am. If you have a question, ask, don't assume I'll let you know, because I won't. I'd rather not say anything, then risk the possibility of boring you with the details of my life. I am able to read loud & clear when something I say doesn't interest you, so, you'll have to forgive me if I wait till you ask. And really, it doesn't bother me. I don't mind hearing about all the things that are going on in your life, I enjoy it, I'm a listener. So please, don't feel bad if you are doing all the talking. It's the fake interest that's irritates me & causes a lump to form in my throat. If I begin to sense that, I'll stop talking. So, just so you are aware, I'm not going to feed any egos by assuming a fan-like personna & giving you the pleasure of having me contact you & you getting back to me when it's convenient. I'm not going to beg. And I'm not going to buy the "I'm busy" excuse. And I'm not? Really, who isn't? I really shouldn't even be letting this get to me, but, sadly, I am. So next time you feel the need to make a comment that I, or someone else you know, doesn't keep in touch, check yourself. When was the last time you picked up the phone, when was the last time you e-mailed or when was the last time you visited? The sad thing is, the people that need to see this won't. I apologize for preaching to the choir. Okay, I'm stepping off my soapbox now.
He promptly took it again & got ...what a contrast! But I always knew he was a graceful & good natured person!

Just a little bit, because that's all I know. (I hope my facts are correct.) My dad's dad's mom's dad was a constable, Constable Mueller, in Germany before coming over to the United States with dreams of providing a better life for his wife & 4 children. He worked here for a year before sending for his wife & kids. They were over here for a year before my dad's dad's mom's dad, was killed by a train in Corapolis. So my dad's dad's mom's mom was left raising four children & she didn't know any English! When either my dad's dad's dad, or my dad's dad's dad's dad parent's passed away a friend took my relative in, despite the fact that he was over 18 & I guess kinda adopted him. Out of respect my relative changed his surname from Harper to my current last name. Yep, that's right, my real last name should be Harper, but because of the kind actions of one man, it was changed. I like my last name because it's different & not common at all. It's not even on the US urlLink census report.
I'm really, really embarrassed to report this, but, I, apparently, belong in... The Power Rangers Movie! urlLink What movie Do you Belong in? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

When you hear a kind word spoken about a friend, tell him so. Never hesitate to do what you know is right. Don't work for recognition, but do work worthy of recognition. Remember that a kind word goes a long way. Take some silly photos of yourself & a friend in an instant photo booth. Earn your success based on service to others, not at the expense of others. Spend twice as much time praising as you do criticizing. Seek respect rather than popularity. Never forget that it takes only one person, or one idea, to change your life forever. When you need a little advice, call your grandparents. Teach your son as well as your daughters to cook. Shoot a few hoops. Never ignore an old barking dog. Never criticize your country when travelling abroad. Keep a pad & pencil by every phone. Never let the odds keep you from persuing what you know in your heart you were meant to do. Count your change. Celebrate even small victories. Cut your toenails in private. After going to bed, refuse to worry about problems until the morning.

I am a muse. The muses of greek mythology were goddesses who ruled over the arts & sciences & inspired people who were best at them. Their numbers vary from legend to legend, but most agree that there were nine of them who each presided over their own realm. urlLink What legend are you? .

I went to my urlLink cousin's volleyball game last night & stopped in to say hi to Coach Marhefka & the rest of the SRU basketball coaches. Now I've known Marhefka for years & the other coaches for about a year & they've never done anything to frighten me. However, yesterday, when I was talking to them, I started to shake so hard, my body temperature went up & my voice started to quiver. WHY ? Did they notice? They had to have, I was shaking that much. They didn't say anything, thankfully, if they did. Thing is, I talked to them after the game & everything was fine, no body spasms, temperature went up again, but that's because it was hot in the office, but my voice stayed normal. Yeah, go figure. Sometimes I'm confused by myself. Once I figure out me, then I'll be able to move on to the opposite sex. My cousin's team won their game in 5 matches & volleyball sure has changed a lot since I last watched a match.
Do y'all make mistakes, just people think you are human? I'm doing that a lot today! Trying to fool the officemates!

Woodland Hills defeated Central Catholic, 49-48, in a overtime thriller. Apparently Central was down & made quite a comeback to almost win the game. Okay, so I was told that the game went something like this: WH 1st Possession - Touchdown CC 1st Possesion - Interception WH 2nd Possession - Touchdown So within the first 5 minutes of the game, WH was up 14-0. With five minutes left they were up 41-20 & CC scored 3 touchdowns in those 5 minutes to tie the game. They scored in overtime, WH scored in overtime & decided they were going to go for 2, all or nothing. The only good thing about the Pitt Game was we got to sit in the Club Seat section with all the State Senators.

Well I'll tell you what I don't like to do. I don't like to come home & have to pick up garbage that someone's loose dog decided he had a right to go through. The same dog that charged me a couple of weeks ago. (Which happened to produce my first & only girly scream.) The same dog that would let me out of my house this evening by charging me back up the stairs. Now I know why he didn't want me down on the sidewalk. I'm going to have to get the Edgewood Police involved in this matter, you know, give them some excitement!

I think I'm going to the Pitt v. Notre dame football game on Saturday, & I have a feeling it's going to be a stellar, fight to the end sorta, game. Last year Pitt lost @ Notre Dame by, I think, a field goal & but despite the loss they pretty much dominated the Fighting Irish in every respect, including penalties, which apparently is what cost them the game. I haven't been to a Pitt game yet this year, so I'm looking forward to it. I know it won't be anything like the Pitt v. Penn State game, which was absolutely awesome, except everyone listened to Walt Harris & didn't rush the field, when the Panthers won. I so wanted to rush the field. Oh & Cherie, they had police on horses! Last Pitt game I went to was last season. I went with a bunch of friends & family members. One friend in particular had a good time tailgating before hand & called to tell us where to meet him. Conversation went something like this: Scott: We're at gate A. No wait, gate C. Hold on it's gate A. Me: Um Scott, you aren't drunk are you? (Yep me, master of the obvious!) Scott: Maybe just a little. And we are definitely at gate C. The Steelers will hopefully redeem themselves this Sunday in Denver. And hopefully Plaxico won't miss the plane, because he couldn't decide which car to drive. And they better put in my Ward! One of the announcers made a comment last week that everyone drops the ball, except Ward, yet they never pass him the ball! Come the kid has a heart twice as big as he is. Size doesn't matter to him, he'll take on & take out anyone that gets in his way. The big game though happens on Friday night, Central Catholic Vikings v. the Woodland Hills Wolverines. This is classified as the big game because I actually know someone who is on the team, cousin Ben! Two years ago the two met twice, in the first game Central lost by a field goal I believe, maybe even an extra point, but it was a great game, a definite fight to the finish. The next time they meet was, I believe, during playoffs & everyone was expecting a great game. So we all headed over to Heinz Field to watch & if I remember correctly, Central got spanked. Last year they got spanked, again, this time in the rain & mud. I asked Ben what his predictions were for this year & he said, oh, we're gonna get killed. Way to be behind your team 110% buddy! I don't think they'll get slaughtered, but winning's going to be a fight. Hopefully we are both wrong & Central comes out fighting & they end up ahead by double digits at the half, enabling Ben to get in! That's all! Are you ready for some football?
